content.description: Sit start in the front sprocket. Go up on the pinch or crimps to the rail and traverse to the right and top out by the tree. The crux is at the end of the traverse where you can either heel hook or keep your feet low. You’re really close to the ground so no need for a pad though you could put one in there if you want. It’s soft dirt below. Someone has certainly done this a long time ago and they can take the first ascent if they want it.
content.location: Walk past the hart boulders on Quinsicket rd. The craggy boulder is on the right at the base of the hill. There is a main trail right next to it.

content.description: Sit start below the small bulge, climb up the seam to the shelf in the middle of the wall, traverse a few moves to the left until you can move up onto the ledge ~10' off the ground. The full line then moves left a few feet to the large left-facing sidepull flake and follows it straight up to an easy but sketchy topout. If you don't want to do the top-out you can always walk off the ledge to the left as for the finish of Death by Pizza.
content.location: Left of the shared start for Sprocket Rocket/Crank it, starting on the left side of the Death Crack wall, left of the sprocket/groove.

content.description: Start sitting (or maybe squatting?) on left side of bulge, fire up a move then traverse right to finish up on the Death by Pizza topout.Lee Soares worked this a bunch back in the day but I don't think he ever sent it.
content.location: Obvious bulge as you walk up to Death Crack.

content.description: Start sitting under the right side of the bulge. Fire up and top out onto the ledge. Walk off the ledge to the left.
content.location: Right side of obvious bulge at Death Crack.

content.description: Start ar for Death by Pizza underneath the small roof, work up through holds in the crack on the right and sloping edges on the left of the bulge to get yourself atop the first tier. Instead of walking off left, climb straight up through the crack behind the tree. There are good holds in the crack and the climbing is much easier than the first portion of the climb, it does feel a bit sketchier pulling up over the second tier with the small tree behind you.
content.protection: Several pads, a fall from the upper tier would be dangerous.
content.location: Left side of the Death Crack wall, just left of the tree on the upper tier.

content.description: Starts on the second tier of this boulder, walk up by the tree and reach out to a crimp edge (level with the bole of the tree), match this, and either pull your feet onto the upper boulder or drop into a campus. From here go up and left to a shelf, match it up, and then grab a good crimp rail up and to the left to bring your feet up high and rock over onto the very low angle slab topout.
content.location: Left side of the Death Crack boulder, the start of this problem is on the face directly next to the downclimb to Death by Pizza.

content.description: Sit start as for sprocket rocket at the base of the groove, climb up through pinches and crimps and then pass the sprocket rocket rail to the seam above. Follow this seam left to a shared topout with sprocket rocket.
content.location: Shared start with Sprocket Rocket, in the middle of the Death Crack wall.

content.description: Start deep under bulge matched up on large incut flake with feet on large ramps below you. Reach up and back to a crimp in the middle of the bulge, match it and then move up through slopers to the lip. There are a series of sloping crimps at the lip from which you can reach back to a shallow 3 finger pocket that helps bring the left foot up. Pop the left hand out to the arete and from there you can bring your feet up and rock over onto the top of the boulder. It might be possible to do this climb without the huge starting feet at a harder grade, but it would then be a super uncomfortable start and likely less fun.
content.location: Far right side of the Death Crack boulder, around the corner/tree from the shaft/crank it/sprocket rocket.

content.description: Nice cluster of fun moderate climbs, some low balls, some high. 18ft tall if you climb the second level. There are great pinches, slopers, crack, and some crimps.
